intro: Micranthes cismagadanica, commonly known as the Transcarpathian micranthus, is a flowering plant native to the Carpathian Mountains. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many other flowering plants with small, four-petaled flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, rocky habitats and has basal leaves that are linear to oblanceolate in shape. Its flowers are usually white or pale yellow, and it produces small, rounded seed pods. Micranthes cismagadanica is of interest to botanists due to its limited distribution and unique ecological adaptations.
